main event: A civilian observed a light at a mining concern in Lima for a period of two hours. The witness initially thought the object was a balloon, but it was later identified as a meteorological balloon.
interesting points: The object was also observed for a period of time at Cajamarce, during night time observations by a weather station high in the mountains between Cajamarce and Huacarape.
The report mentions a tendency of hysteria concerning aerial objects since the advent of Sputnik, and an attempt is being made to not accuse individuals merely on the statements of eyewitnesses.
The report concludes that the object was probably a balloon or the planet Venus.
The report is from a Project Blue Book document, which was a U.S. Air Force program that investigated UFO sightings.
The report does not contain any photographs, but it appears to be a page from a Project Blue Book record card.
sighted object: a light, in the appearance of a balloon
